author: JamesWTruher
body:
- [x] Categorizes all pester tests.
- [x] Code is up-to-date with `master`.

this enables only tests marked as CI will run in our Travis/AppVeyor environments. test count is now ~1800 and usually runs in less than 3 minutes

comments.author: JamesWTruher
comments.body: it looks like the appveyor run succeeded (no test failures) but something else happened

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
My guess is that the conflicts are from IsCore changing to IsCoreCLR (just a guess).

I'm also hesitant to strictly whitelist tests. While we do need to run only a subset of tests, by whitelisting we risk people adding tests, not tagging them, seeing the build pass, and assuming their tests were run. We need a procedure to ensure people adding tests tag them appropriately, but in the basic scenario where they add a test and push to run it on CI, they should be probably be able to do so without tagging it.

Is it possible to warn if there are tests without tags? I think that would be a good compromise.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: @andschwa Jim added code that fails the build, if tests are not tagged, so we are good here.

comments.author: JamesWTruher
comments.body:
yes, before the build is even started I inspect all the tests. If there is a describe block without a tag, or a tag which is not CI, FEATURE, SCENARIO, or SLOW we won't even start building
the function which does the checking for tags contains the list of allowed tags, so we can add tags in the future easily enough
